channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN

item.title: Report E-2024040346
item.description:
Report E-2024040346

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 5, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of hypochlorite solution had a faulty valve and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. E3 personnel utilized absorbent pads and neutralized the impacted-dock floor. The new tote of product was properly labeled and staged onsite for further transport. The damaged 275-gallon tote was deconstructed and placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. All debris and generated waste were collected and containerized into the same one (1) 55-gallon poly drum with the deconstructed tote.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to our attention after it was found wet and leaking. Package was promptly placed into a tote and transferred to the hazmat cage for further inspection. DescribePack: The package was wet and leaking. One of the bottles had the seams under the neck of the bottle separated which resulted in a minor leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

The tote was than transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: There were small wet catches at the top of the box. One of the bottles had a loosened cap that resulted in a minor leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional chance for leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024040565
item.description:
Report X-2024040565

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: KINGSPORT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by P&D Manger Jon Gabriel who notified Ops Supervisor Nate Perry. When I arrived to the scene, i found a box leaking white powder like substance. Upon further inspection I found a 5 gallon bucket inside of a box that was busted and had leaked most of the contents out of the bucket into the box. DescribePack: There was a major crack down the side of the bucket and busted at the bottom of the sidewall. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was swiftly taken to the hazmat processing area and was transferred into a lined salvage drum.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat, undeclared, spill incident. No DOT labels, UN number, or Proper Shipping Name found on outside of package. Leaking fiberboard box found in lined tote on HMPA staging pallet. No OP-951; no prior events known. DescribePack: One of twelve 1 quart plastic bottles lost 0.2 quart of fluid from a failed safety seal below the cap closure. All contents mildly soiled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2024040266
item.description:
Report X-2024040266

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: HUMBOLDT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Packaged Handlers were unloading a van that had the Hazmat. The Hazmat was toppled over when found and was leaking some of the chloride inside (solid). Package Handlers contacted an Ops Manager and informed QA/Coordinator of the incident. We removed the packaged from the vehicle and put it in a bucket to keep spilling anymore of the contents inside the station. It was taken to the Hazmat cage where upon further inspection found that the Hazmat material was inside of a plastic cylinder (outer container is a cardboard box). While transferring the leaking Hazmat, it was found that the bottom of the cylinder had cracked and was leaking a massive amount of the chlorine. The box itself was already filled halfway with the leaking contents. Admins wore protective gloves and used the ventilation shaft to not inhale the "fumes" of the chloride. The Hazmat was placed in a Hazmat container and DPR/ISF were filled out. DescribePack: The packaged appeared to have been repacked as it has a new label and was missing the shipping documents and had lots of tape wrapped around the closures. Looking at the photos from previous stations before it's arrival to the current one, it was in a much nicer box with better taping/packaging. The bucket likely could have been dropped at some point during it's transport casuing the bottom portion to be cracked, or likely from moving around inside the box as it did not have any filling inside to prevent the contents from moving around. The driver also could have secured the package to stop it from sliding around on the floor, perhaps had it on one of the shelves. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was removed immediately from the van and into a bucket in order to take it to the hazmat cage.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

THE PKG WAS PLACED INSIDE A LINED HAZMAT TOTE INSIDE THE HAZMAT CAGE FOR EVALUATION DescribePack: ONE OF THE CONTENT CAP CAME OFF WHICH CAUSED INTERNAL LEAKAGE DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: TURNED UPRIGHT AND CAPS TIGHTENED

item.title: Report X-2024040174
item.description:
Report X-2024040174

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-12T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with an odor was presented to the MEMH spill office. While investigating the package the spill agent discovered that the metal jerrycan inside was leaking from the bottom chime. The jerrycan was packaged inside of a plastic bag with styrofoam top and bottom. The contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration for movement.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiber board box was presented to the MEMH spill office as having an odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent discovered that the contents were leaking. Inside was a single paint can and the bottom chime was damaged casing the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
